Record Class Context.Value

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
com.javax0.logiqua.Context.Value
Record Components:
get - the actual value wrapped in this object. Also, the getter for this is called get().
Enclosing interface:
Context
public static record Context.Value(Object get) extends Record
A wrapper for a contextual value. This is to distinguish between null values and values that are not present.

This wrapper is almost like a java.util.Optional, but it is not a generic type. We use this wrapper instead of an optional, because when returning an optional from a method, it is assumed to be not null. When the return type is Value, then it can also be null, which is means the value is not present. With the optional, you cannot return a value that is present and invalid input: '{@' @code null}.

    • equals

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with Objects::equals(Object,Object).
      Specified by:
